name: Found (Audio CD - 2013) by The Daydream Club
description: Found is the rootsy folk-pop lead single from The Daydream Club's EP of the same name. The track which has already featured in acoustic form on Burberry's Youtube channel is exactly what The Daydream Club are known for, Adam Pickering and Paula Walker's trademark girl/boy harmonies that are found layered authentically over southern tinged steel string and strums. Found delivers equal measures of stomp along and intimate pullbacks in both the dynamics and the drive. Found is the product of a hugely successful fan funding campaign that saw fans pledge money for songwriting lessons, bespoke cover versions and even a personalised song from the band. As part of the campaign Adam & Paula thanked each and every backer with a personalised thank you dedication picture. Some of these pictures make up the artwork for the EP. Never settled with just one version of a song, Adam & Paula like to experiment with alternatives and re-imagine their own work. Found (Remixed) involves them stretching their musical legs and flipping the original songs on their heads. Expect funky "The Meters" inspired beats, shuffled pianos, vast soundscapes, deep bass and synths. Released on the same date as Found. Get Found & Found (Remixed) as a Bundle Offer HERE Watch the Official Music Video for Found HERE Listen to Found & Found (Remixed) HERE TRACK LISTING: 1. Found 2. Soundwaves of Gold 3. Remember Me 4. Fear of Wolves 5. Little face LINKS: Website Facebook Twitter Youtube Myspace Pinterest Bandcamp PPR02CD 5029385995485

name: Bundle Offer: FoundTheDaydreamClub (CD + Mp3) by The Daydream Club
description: With the FoundTheDaydreamClub Bundle Offer you will get: 1. Found - EP (Audio CD - 2013) 2. Found (Remixed) - EP (Mp3 - 2013) To learn more about each release click on the titles and it will take you to our Bandcamp page where you can read the blurb and listen to each song. You will receive your unique Digital Download Codes as part of your physical bundle in the post. Found is the rootsy folk-pop lead single from The Daydream Club's EP of the same name. The track which has already featured in acoustic form on Burberry's Youtube channel is exactly what The Daydream Club are known for, Adam Pickering and Paula Walker's trademark girl/boy harmonies that are found layered authentically over southern tinged steel string and strums. Found delivers equal measures of stomp along and intimate pullbacks in both the dynamics and the drive. Found is the product of a hugely successful fan funding campaign that saw fans pledge money for songwriting lessons, bespoke cover versions and even a personalised song from the band. As part of the campaign Adam & Paula thanked each and every backer with a personalised thank you dedication picture. Some of these pictures make up the artwork for the EP. The Daydream Club also personally remixed each track to form the Found (Remixed) EP. This features completely re-imagined songs with Funky beats, shuffled pianos, big synths and an alternative slant on the original songs. Never settled with just one version of a song, Adam & Paula like to experiment with alternatives and re-imagine their own work. Found (Remixed) involves them stretching their musical legs and flipping the original songs on their heads. Expect funky "The Meters" inspired beats, shuffled pianos, vast soundscapes, deep bass and synths. Released on the same date as Found. name: Overgrown (Signed Audio CD - 2010) by The Daydream Club
description: This is the only place online where you can get a signed copy. Each order is personally signed by The Daydream Club. If you would like a specific message, drop them an email here once you've ordered from the shop and let them know what message you would like on your CD. The premise behind Overgrown was to strip everything right back to the bare bones of a song aiming to highlight the arrangement that remains. It was this idea that led to the intimate acoustic affair which is The Daydream Clubs debut release. Of the title record they say, "Overgrown is about losing sight of where you want to be but continuing on blindly regardless." “Overgrown is a simply delightful collection of thoughtful songs, arranged in modest and understated ways that allow you to touch their lyrical core.” Consequence of Sound 4/5 ✶✶✶✶ "The Daydream Club take their own passion and create something so evocative that it has its own soul and that’s what I love about them as a band and about the album." Hive Magazine 4/5 ✶✶✶✶ “It’s absolutely extraordinary.” BBC This 13 track album touches upon various musical genres. “The Affair” is a dark, heart-wrenching tale supported by a dramatic composition that is reminiscent of old movie scores, with elements of both classical and jazz piano. “Square”, with its simplistic lyrics, is more accessible and has an underlying pop sensibility. Folk influences are obvious in songs like “Be With You Always”, “The Record Shop” and “In The Arms of Another Day”. Warm vocal harmonies in “Alarms Ring Out” reflect on the impact of the recession. The rhythmically driven track “On The Move” showcases the percussive guitar skills of Adam Pickering, combined with the crystal vocals of Paula Walker. TRACK LISTING: 1. On The Move 2. The Affair 3. Alarms Ring Out 4. The Record Shop 5. Neon Love Song 6. Overgrown 7. Touch My Bones 8. English Rain 9. Square 10. In The Arms Of Another Day 11. A Picture Of You 12. Be With You Always 13. Fisherman's Tale LINKS: Website Facebook Twitter Youtube Myspace Pinterest Bandcamp PPR01CD 5060227314668

name: The Record Shop (Limited Edition 7" Vinyl + Mp3's 2011) by The Daydream Club
description: The Record Shop single is a special, limited edition vinyl release aimed to coincide with Record Store Day 2011. It features previously unreleased, cinematic instrumental B-Side The Musician. The specially designed vinyl sleeve features photographs of 40 independent UK record shops, plus each individual vinyl will be numbered. With your vinyl you will also receive the digital mp3 downloads of the single (A + B Sides) The Record Shop was written as a tribute to the golden years of vinyl and independent record stores. It reflects on the current state of the industry, noting the demise in value of the physical product in favour of digital technologies. This is highlighted in the song through the story of a fragile old man and his shop, with all of its wonderful quirks that his loyal customers have grown to love. “We didn’t know about Record Store Day when we wrote the track” explains Adam, “but the lyrics really seem to resonate with people, who like us, enjoy trawling through record shops and discovering musical gems.” "WOW!... Really astonishing musicianship... they met at LIPA, so no wonder they're so bloomin' good." BBC 6 Music, Tom Robinson "I listen to that song and want to visit my nearest independent record store straight away." Hive Magazine "Gosh, their music is exquisite... We think you should listen to the incredibly more-ish 'The Record Shop." Notion Magazine "Understated and yet very intriguing, some wonderful song-craft!" Amazing Radio, Charlie Ashcroft TRACK LISTING: SIDE A: THE RECORD SHOP SIDE B: THE MUSICIAN ** With your vinyl order you will also receive digital versions of both tracks via email Produced by Shane Bowler (shane_b@ntlworld.com) Artwork by STUDIO|Nova (gemmalouisehall@hotmail.com) LINKS: Website Facebook Twitter Youtube Myspace Pinterest Bandcamp PPR01VL 5029385990985
